Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, I need to analyze the event log and identify activities that appear multiple times within the same case. From the log: - Activity Initiate Request appears once in each case, so no recurrence. - Verify Documents appears multiple times in C001 and C003, but only once in C002. In C001, it happens at 09:20:00 and 10:30:00. In C003, at 11:25:00 and 12:20:00. In C002, only once. - Call Customer appears multiple times in C001, C002, and C003. In C001: once at 09:45:00. In C002: twice, at 09:00:00 and 09:50:00. In C003: once at 11:50:00. - Adjust Account appears in C002 and C003, but only once each, so no recurrence within a case. - Approve Request appears once in each case, no recurrence. - Other activities like Submit Additional appear only in C001, once.

In C001, Verify Documents recurs, in C002, Call Customer recurs, in C003, both Verify Documents and Call Customer but Call Customer only once in C003? So, Verify Documents recurs in C001 and C003, and Call Customer recurs in C002.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now, I need to interpret how their meaning changes based on context. Starting with Verify Documents: - In C001, first occurrence: Agent checks identity documents. (after initial request) - Second occurrence: Agent re-checks documents now that ID scan is provided. So, it is a re-verification after additional documents are submitted. - In C003, first occurrence: Physical verification of ID. (at branch) - Second occurrence: Re-verify docs after account adjustment. So again, a re-verification. Contextual difference: The first Verify Documents is initial verification, and the second is re-verification or follow-up verification.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: For Call Customer: - In C001: Verification incomplete, agent calls to request missing docs. So, it is to request missing information. - In C002: First call at 09:00:00: Outbound call to clarify account discrepancy. Second call at 09:50:00: Follow-up call to confirm adjustments made. So, first is to clarify an issue, second is to confirm actions. - In C003: Customer stepped out. Officer calls to have them return. So, it is to recall the customer. Thus, Call Customer has different purposes: requesting info, clarifying issues, follow-up confirmation, or recalling customer.
